results.title: azorean_vascular plants
results.description: The data presented here comes from field observations, carried out between 2014 and 2017, as part of a LIFE research project aiming to preserve and restore three coastal wetlands of Praia da Vitória (Terceira Island, Azores, Portugal) (LIFE-CWR). A total of 23 vascular plant species surveys were carried out in three sites: one for each semester in Paul da Praia da Vitória (PPV) and Paul da Pedreira do Cabo da Praia (PPCP); one for each semester (except in 2014) in Paul do Belo Jardim (PBJ). Main objectives were to determine the plant richness of the three sites and monitor seasonal and between year variation on species composition.

citation.text: Elias R B, Brito M R, Pimentel C, Nogueira E C, Borges P A V (2019). azorean_vascular plants. Version 1.7. Universidade dos Açores. Sampling event dataset https://doi.org/10.15468/dsa0vo accessed via GBIF.org on 2019-10-21.

project.title: Inventory of vascular plant species of three coastal wetlands of Terceira Island (Azores)

contacts.lastName: Miguel Pires Bento da Silva Elias

project.funding: Supported by the project LIFE CWR – Ecological Restoration and Conservation of Praia da Vitória Coastal Wet Green Infrastructure (2013-2018).
project.studyAreaDescription: The Azores belong to the Holarctic Biogeographical Kingdom and Eurosiberian Region (Rivas-Martinez et al. 2002). Terceira Island is the third largest island of the archipelago and has the fourth longest shoreline (Forjaz et al. 2004). Like other Azorean islands (with the exception of Santa Maria and Graciosa), the prevalent type of climate in Terceira is temperate with no dry season and with a mild summer (Köppen Climate Classification - Cfb). However, in Praia da Vitória (a lowland area in the east of the island) the climate is temperate with hot and dry summers (Csa) (Climate Atlas 2012). For more details on the description of the study area see Borges et al. (2018).
project.designDescription: At the three wetland sites, a total of 23 surveys were carried out for a total of 51 days of direct observation. Surveys took place (except for PBJ in 2014) every semester. Study areas were delimited using GPS and included the margins of the bodies of water and the surrounding terrestrial areas.
project.abstract: This work is part of comprehensive study regarding the biodiversity of the coastal wetlands of Praia da Vitória (Terceira, Azores) under the scope of the LIFE-CWR coastal wetlands restoration project. The aim of this work was to inventory the vascular plants present in the three coastal areas of Praia da Vitória (PPV, PBJ and PPCP), in order to determine the plant richness of the three sites and between year variation in species composition.

samplingDescription.studyExtent: This study covers a small coastal area with 3.58 km extension between PPV and PPCP.
samplingDescription.sampling: At the three wetland sites, a total of 23 surveys were carried out for a total of 51 days of direct observation. Surveys took place (except for PBJ in 2014) every semester. Study areas were delimited using GPS and included the margins of the bodies of water and the surrounding terrestrial areas.
methodSteps: On the data table were included all the records for which a taxonomic identification of the species was possible. The dataset submitted to GBIF is structured as a sample event dataset, with two tables: event (as core) and occurrences. The data in this sampling event resource has been published as a Darwin Core Archive (DwCA), which is a standardised format for sharing biodiversity data as a set of one or more data tables. The core data table contains 23 records. One extension data table also exists. An extension record supplies extra information about a core record. The number of records in each extension data table is illustrated in the IPT link. This IPT archives the data and thus serves as the data repository. The data and resource metadata are available for downloading in the downloads section. The versions table lists other versions of the resource that have been made publicly available and allows tracking changes made to the resource over time.

results.title: Cerceris fumipennis nest sites
results.description: The solitary parasitoid wasp Cerceris fumipennis provisions its nests with beetles from the Family Buprestidae. Nests formed by these solitary wasps are often located in non-social colonies within hard-packed, sandy, and exposed soils. Female wasps forage for prey on sunny summer days when many species of buprestid beetles are active. Taking buprestid beetle prey from wasps intercepted as they approached their nests is used to survey for the presence of many buprestid species. Biologists and citizen science volunteers surveyed C. fumipennis colonies for Buprestidae from 2009-2016.

citation.text: McFarland K (2019). Cerceris fumipennis nest sites. Vermont Center for Ecostudies. Occurrence dataset https://doi.org/10.15468/w6knbz accessed via GBIF.org on 2019-10-21.

results.title: Plantas de la expedición en el cañon medio del Chicamocha, Boyacá - Proyecto Boyacá BIO
results.description: Bajo el convenio especial de cooperación No. 17-170 entre la gobernación del departamento de Boyacá y el Instituto Alexander von Humboldt se realizó a cabo una evaluación biológica y ecológica en la Cuenca media del Rio Chicamocha en el departamento de Boyacá, se realizaron muestreos de biodiversidad de diferentes grupos biológicos, en este recurso se presentan los resultados de plantas vasculares. Se obtuvo un total de 159 registros biológicos de 127 especies.

project.title: Análisis de la biodiversidad y los servicios ecosistémicos para su aplicación en la toma de decisiones en el departamento de Boyacá
project.funding: Boyacá BIO. Convenio especial de cooperación No. 17-170 del 2017. Aunar esfuerzos, capacidades y competencias entre el departamento de Boyacá y el Instituto de Investigación de Recursos Biológicos Alexander von Humboldt para la ejecución del proyecto “Análisis de la biodiversidad y los servicios ecosistémicos para su aplicación en la toma de decisiones en el departamento de Boyacá” en cumplimiento de la meta “Expediciones científicas para inventariar la fauna, flora y microorganismos a nivel taxonómico y genético realizadas, mediante Acuerdo N 055 del 7 de marzo de 2017
project.studyAreaDescription: Municipios del departamento de Boyacá

samplingDescription.studyExtent: La cuenca media del Río Chicamocha, se localiza en los municipios de Paz de Río, Socha y Socotá, en el departamento de Boyacá. Cubre un gradiente altitudinal entre los 1787 y 2440 m. Los muestreos se llevaron a cabo en áreas de vegetación xerofítica con matorrales espinosos, en las veredas Chusvitá (Socotá); Sagra Abajo, El Alto, La Chapa, Sochuelo y Pozo Bajo (Socha); Sibaría (Paz de Río).
samplingDescription.sampling: Durante cinco días se realizaron inventarios de plantas vasculares en la cuenca media del Rio Chicamocha, en los municipios de Socha, paz de Rio y Socotá, Boyacá. El inventario de plantas fue llevado a cabo mediante recorridos en cinco localidades previamente seleccionadas en una presalida realizada en el mes de febrero de 2019, y fueron colectadas muestras de plantas con flores y/o frutos. Para cada uno de los individuos colectados se registraron características morfológicas que permitieran su posterior determinación taxonómica en el laboratorio. Adicionalmente, fueron tomadas muestras de tejidos de cada uno de los especímenes colectados y conservados en silica gel.
methodSteps: Fueron tomadas muestras de plantas vasculares con flores y/o frutos, se registraron las caracteristicas de la planta que facilitaran su identificación taxonómica, así como información de la localidad de colecta.

De los especimenes colectados fueron tomadas muestras de tejido de las hojas y conservadas en sílica gel. Las muestras de plantas fueron herborizadas y depositadas en el Herbario Federico Medem Bogotá (FMB) del Instituto Humboldt, con duplicados en el herbario de la UPTC, las muestras de tejidos fueron depositadas en el banco de tejidos del Instituto Humboldt (IAvH-CT).

La identificación taxonómica del material colectado fue realizada en el Herbario FMB, mediante el uso de claves taxonómicas o por comparación con la colección de referencia del Herbario. El listado de las especies generado en el proceso de identificación fue comparado con lo reportado para Colombia y el departamento de Boyacá, en el Catálogo de plantas y líquenes de Colombia (Bernal et al., 2015).

results.title: Anfibios y reptiles de la expedición en el cañon medio del Chicamocha, Boyacá - Proyecto Boyacá BIO
results.description: Bajo el convenio especial de cooperación No. 17-170 entre la gobernación del departamento de Boyacá y el Instituto Alexander von Humboldt se realizó a cabo una evaluación biológica y ecológica rápida en el Cañón medio del Chicamocha en el departamento de Boyacá, se realizaron muestreos de biodiversidad de diferentes grupos biológicos, en este recurso se presentan los resultados de anfibios y reptiles. Se obtuvo un total de 15 registros biológico (5 anfibios y 10 reptiles) distribuidos en 6 especies (2 especies de anfibios y 4 especies de reptiles).

project.title: Análisis de la biodiversidad y los servicios ecosistémicos para su aplicación en la toma de decisiones en el departamento de Boyacá
project.funding: Boyacá BIO. Convenio especial de cooperación No. 17-170 del 2017. Aunar esfuerzos, capacidades y competencias entre el departamento de Boyacá y el Instituto de Investigación de Recursos Biológicos Alexander von Humboldt para la ejecución del proyecto “Análisis de la biodiversidad y los servicios ecosistémicos para su aplicación en la toma de decisiones en el departamento de Boyacá” en cumplimiento de la meta “Expediciones científicas para inventariar la fauna, flora y microorganismos a nivel taxonómico y genético realizadas, mediante Acuerdo N 055 del 7 de marzo de 2017
project.studyAreaDescription: Municipios del departamento de Boyacá

samplingDescription.studyExtent: Durante esta expedición a el Cañon medio del Chicamocha se muestrearon los municipios de Socha y Paz de Río en el departamento de Boyacá. Cubriendo un gradiente altitudinal entre los 2068 m a  2690 m de altitud. Los muestreos se llevaron a cabo en ambientes xericos entre potreros aledaños al rio Chicamocha, charcas, remanentes de bosques y arbustos.  en las veredas Sibaria (municipio de Paz de Rio), Poso bajo y La Chapa (municipio de Socha).
samplingDescription.sampling: Para la caracterización de la herpetofauna presente en el Páramo de Ocetá, llevamos a cabo muestreos diurnos y nocturnos implementando tres estrategias de colecta: 1) búsqueda libre por registro visual (Heyer et al., 1994), 2) registro acústico (Angulo et al., 2006) con obtención de voucher y 3) método de remoción de rocas y troncos. Para la obtención de los ejemplares se usaron equipos de mallas de mano para los estados larvales y ejemplares adultos de difícil consecución. Para los registros individuales se obtuvieron las coordenadas geográficas y sus elevaciones correspondientes usando un GPS Garmin GPSMAP 60CSx (datum WGS 84). También se registraron datos de historia natural (ej: hábitat, comportamientos) de los individuos colectados. Los individuos fueron sacrificados, fijados y preservados usando el protocolo de Simmons (2002).
methodSteps: Se realizó la búsqueda de anfibios y reptiles durante jornadas diurnas y nocturnas. Todos los registros obtenidos fueron georreferenciados con coordenadas y altitud. Adicionalmente se registraron apuntes de hábitat y comportamiento de los individuos en campo. Los individuos fueron transportados en bolsas de tela y bolsas plásticas hacia el campamento.
En el campamento, los individuos fueron fotografiados en vida y posteriormente sacrificados con xilocaina 2% en crema para el caso de anfibios y liquida  para el caso de reptiles.
Se obtuvieron muestras de tejidos (preferiblemente hígado o músculo) para la mayoría de los ejemplares colectados. Las muestras de tejidos fueron preservadas en alcohol al 96%.
Los ejemplares fueron fijados en Formol analítico al 10% y transportados en un recipiente hermético al Instituto Alexander von Humboldt, Sede Villa de Leyva.
Una vez en el Instituto Alexander von Humboldt, se pasaron los ejemplares a agua con el fin de retirar el formol. Posteriormente los ejemplares fueron preservados en alcohol al 70%.
Se corroboraron las determinaciones taxonómicas usando revisiones y claves. Posteriormente se realizó el archivo de migración de datos con la información correspondiente a cada ejemplar.
Los ejemplares fueron catalogados e ingresados a la colección de anfibios (IAvH-AM) y reptiles (IAvH-R).

results.title: NeoWild Brownsberg Nature Park Camera trap Monitoring 2016-2017
results.description: Brownsberg nature Park is the most visited protected area in Suriname. Sixteen camera trapping stations, some with two opposite cameras, were positioned at Brownsberg Nature Park in 2012. After a trial period the cameras worked continuous from January 2013 till Augustus 2017. After which they were placed for 4 to 10 months per year. The initial objective was to investigate the impact of eco-tourism on the mammal community. Later other interesting subjects were explored as well (i.e. impact of illegal gold mining, competition between jaguars and pumas, and density estimations). This data set shows only the large terrestrial mammals (>1 kg body mass) and terrestrial birds for the period December 2015 till August 2017. However more than half of the triggers were caused by human activity (tourists, cars, road workers, etc.). The principal investigators of the camera trapping research projects were/are Paul Ouboter and Vanessa Kadosoe, while several students occasionally assisted or carried out thesis research on related subjects (Dimitri Ouboter and Geeta Thakoerdien).

citation.text: Ouboter P, Ouboter D, Kadosoe V (2019). NeoWild Brownsberg Nature Park Camera trap Monitoring 2016-2017. Version 1.1. NeoWild. Occurrence dataset https://doi.org/10.15468/apqeyf accessed via GBIF.org on 2019-10-21.

taxonomicCoverages.description: All specimens from this expedition were identified either to family, genus or species level.

geographicCoverages.description: The geographic coverage for the Brownsberg Nature Park Monitoring encompasses the central and northern part of the Brownsberg Mountain plateau, including slopes.

project.title: Identification and use of indicator taxa for human impact monitoring
project.funding: IBER and NeoWild
project.studyAreaDescription: On parts of the plateau there is Mesophytic tropical rainforest, as well as on the slopes and creek valleys. The more rocky parts of the plateau have Xerophytic tropical rainforest.
project.designDescription: A total of 16 locations were fitted with cameras, but later on in the research a total of 22 cameras were used. The cameras were spaced 0.8 to 1.4 km apart. Usually two cameras were placed almost opposite to each other. The camera traps were served on a monthly basis.
project.abstract: Amphibians and mammals were used as indicator taxa at Brownsberg Nature Park. The impacts that were  investigated were ecotourism and illegal gold mining.

samplingDescription.studyExtent: During the Brownsberg Nature Park Camera trap Monitoring, the area was continuously sampled. The cameras were serviced on a monthly basis.
samplingDescription.sampling: The photographs were collected through camera trapping.
samplingDescription.qualityControl: Occasionally the identification of specimens was rechecked by a foreign expert.
methodSteps:
1. Camera traps were positioned in the field on tree trunks along made made roads and trails
2. The cameras were serviced every month, during which the batteries, memory card and desiccant were changed.
3. The photographs were uploaded on a computer and sorted using Camelot software.
4. The animals on the photographs were identified based on field guides and own experience.

results.title: Reptiles del Perú
results.description: Se presentan los listados de los reptiles, elaborados en el marco del documento “Situación actual de las especies de anfibios y reptiles del Perú”. Este esfuerzo ha permitido identificar a 469 especies de reptiles, entre terrestres y acuáticos, distribuidas en territorio peruano. Estos resultados fueron corroborados con documentos relacionados a nomenclatura normalizada, adopciones de nuevas especies, revisión detallada de bibliografía especializada, especímenes de museos y centros de investigación, así como consultas con especialistas y gestores de los 3 niveles del gobierno.

methodSteps: Para la elaboración del documento, se recopiló información relevante como la clasificación taxonómica general para cada especie, incluyendo los siguientes ítems: a. Orden, b. Suborden, c. Familia, d. Género, e. Subespecies (cuando fuera necesario), f. Nombre común, en español e inglés, g. Autor o autores y año de descripción de la especie, h. Categoría de conservación nacional (MINAGRI, 2014), i. Categoría CITES (2018), j. Categoría CMS (2018), k. Categoría IUCN (2018), l. Categorizaciones previas a nivel nacional (INRENA, 1999; MINAG, 2004), m. Distribución (local, regional, nacional o Sudamérica), n. Rango altitudinal (mínimo, máximo, nacional o global), o. Hábitat, p. Distribución por departamento y ecorregión, q. Presencia en otros países, r. Impactos, s. Usos, t. Referencias bibliográficas que sustentan el registro de cada especie.

geographicCoverages.description: The Yungas or the Subtropical Mountain Forest.

samplingDescription.studyExtent: All records of this work is located within the Yungas, a mountain rain forest. Yungas are phytogeographical province, extending from the south of Venezuela into NW Argentina along the Andean mountain range. In Argentina they are distributed discontinuously within the provinces of Salta, Jujuy, Tucumán and Catamarca, along part of the subandean chains, and they represent one of the most species-rich biogeographic provinces. Four types of forests can be differentiated along the altitudinal gradient according to the vegetation physiognomy and species composition. The Premontane Forest (Selva Pedemontana), with high diversity of tree species, characterizes the lowest altitudinal level (between 400 and 700 m) of the Yungas. On the east side of this formation transitional forests are in contact with and give way to another ecoregion, the dry Chaco. To the west and up the mountains, the Premontane Forest gives rise to the Montane Humid  Forest (Selva  Montana), rich in tree species, which expands  between 700 and 1500 m a.s.l. Above the Montane Humid Forest start the Upper  Montane Forests and Open Woodlands  (Bosque  Montano), which expand up to 2500-3000 m. Above this altitude the high altitude Foggy Montane Grasslands (Pastizales de Neblina) arise. To the west of the Yungas, the high Andes are characterized by arid mountain tops and plateaus with bare ground and scarce vegetation (the High Andean Grasslands and rocky outcrops).
samplingDescription.sampling: Larvae and adults were collected using standardized methods with kicknet, D- frame net, Surber sampler (300 μm mesh) and light traps. The specimens were fixed in 4% formalin or 96% ethyl alcohol and conserved in 70% or 96% ethyl alcohol. Taxonomic identifications were made to genus level using available keys.
methodSteps: Biodiversidad Neotropical (IBN), (CONICET – UNT), Argentina. The dataset was made with LibreOffice and the data was cleaned with the OpenRefine 3.2 program, both programs are open access. All the data of the labels of the samples were transcribed in the database. The samples are preserved in 70% or 96% ethyl alcohol, inside glass vial. If the genitalia of some specimen were studied, it was conserved into a different eppendorf inside. For subsequent DNA studies, some of the samples were stored in a freezer. Each vial was designated a unique collection code, consisting of three parts: name of the abbreviated institution, taxonomic order category and vial number (eg. IBN-E-300). Each vial may contain more than one specimen and in some case, more than one species. All vials are deposited in metal cabinet, in a room without windows with constant humidity and temperature of 50% and 23°C (air conditioning and dehumidifier). The strong point of our collection is that most of the collectors are present, so the georeferencing and the absence of data on the labels were efficiently supplied and verified using digital cartography. The dataset was exported on DarwinCore v.1.4, postvalidation was applied using DARWINTEST software and the metadata was integrated to the dataset in DarwinCore Archive format.

results.title: Caracterización bacteriana del Distrito Nacional de Manejo Integrado Cabo Manglares Bajo Mira y Frontera, Pacífico colombiano - Proyecto Colombia BIO
results.description:
La propuesta de investigación de la Universidad del Sinú se enfocó, originalmente, a la evaluación de la contaminación microbiológica en agua y sedimentos para correlacionar con los contenidos observados en tejidos vivos de la especie de Piangua Anadara tuberculosa; sin embargo, una vez en campo el proyecto adquirió una dimensión mayor, ya que se tuvo la posibilidad de incluir la especie Anadara similis en los muestreos biológicos y a la posibilidad de realizar algunos análisis de laboratorio adicionales. En este contexto, se efectuó un relacionamiento con el personal de DIMAR a fin de complementar la información de contaminación en estas especies, para lo cual la Universidad del Sinú realizó la recolección y separación de muestras de Piangua, para adelantar el registro de hidrocarburos en estos organismos en los laboratorios del CIOH Pacífico.

Durante la fase de campo se logró obtener muestras de Piangua, agua y sedimentos en cuatro (4) localidades, a saber: Candelilla de la Mar, Teherán, Colombia Grande y Tumaco, donde también se registraron los valores de algunas variables fisicoquímicas en el agua superficial. El procesamiento del material biológico se llevó a cabo en el laboratorio montado en el buque “7 de agosto” de la Armada Nacional de Colombia. Las muestras de Piangua, agua y sedimento se almacenaron en congelación en el buque hasta su traslado por vía aérea al laboratorio de microbiología de la Universidad del Sinú – Seccional Cartagena.

En total se obtuvo información de 99 registros biológicos.

citation.text: López L, Zarza E (2019). Caracterización bacteriana del Distrito Nacional de Manejo Integrado Cabo Manglares Bajo Mira y Frontera, Pacífico colombiano - Proyecto Colombia BIO. Aunar esfuerzos para caracterizar la biodiversidad en áreas de interés científico y con baja información biológica, para el fortalecimiento de las colecciones científicas y la generación de información genética de la biodiversidad Colombiana, en el marco del programa Colombia BIO.

samplingDescription.studyExtent: El proyecto se llevó a cabo en el Departamento de Nariño en el sector meridional del Pacífico colombiano, entre la ensenada de Tumaco y la localidad de Candelilla de la Mar en cercanías de la línea limítrofe con el Ecuador.
samplingDescription.sampling: Los aspectos metodológicos incluyen una breve ubicación del área de estudio, la descripción de procedimientos en la fase de campo, los avances en la fase de laboratorio que se llevó a cabo directamente en el buque, la información de posibilidad de implementación de análisis genéticos en las muestras recopiladas y, finalmente, las variaciones que se generaron en los procedimientos en la fase de campo del proyecto con relación a la propuesta metodológica inicial.
methodSteps: El proyecto de la Universidad del Sinú se llevó a cabo con la participación de las comunidades de Candelilla de la Mar, Teherán, Colombia Grande y del Barrio el Morrito, Sector Chapas; estas comunidades participaron activamente en la recolección de muestras biológicas de la Piangua (Anadara sp.), actividad que se desarrolló en sectores donde tradicionalmente llevan a cabo la extracción de este recurso para su consumo y comercialización. En el caso de las comunidades de Candelilla de la Mar y de Teherán, estos sectores se encontraban bastante alejados del poblado, razón por la cual fue necesario el traslado en embarcaciones hacia los respectivos sitios de muestreo.

En cada localidad de muestreo se realizó una recolección de al menos 30 ejemplares de Piangua hembra (Anadara tuberculosa) y 30 de Piangua macho (Anadara similis); las cantidades de individuos en la muestra de cada especie variaron según la disponibilidad de tiempo, personal y del recurso en cada localidad, pero por lo general siempre fueron en cantidad suficiente tanto para los muestreos de microbiología de la Universidad del Sinú, como de hidrocarburos dentro del trabajo conjunto con el CIOH Pacífico. Este muestreo fue insuficiente en el caso de A. similis en la localidad de Colombia Grande, donde se alcanzó el peso requerido de muestra para el análisis microbiológico, pero fueron pocos ejemplares para el estudio morfométrico, y en Tumaco donde no se encontró disponibilidad suficiente de esta especie por lo que no fue incluida.

La recolección se realizó de manera manual con ayuda de “piangüeros” expertos de las comunidades, quienes eran contactados previamente con ayuda del personal del Consejo Comunitario Bajo Mira y Frontera que hicieron parte de la expedición. El transporte se efectuó en embarcaciones de la Infantería de Marina, DIMAR o de los nativos de la región, salvo en el caso de Tumaco donde se accedió al sitio por vía terrestre. La toma de muestras de Piangua se realizó durante la marea baja entre las raíces de árboles de mangle, en áreas dominadas por especies del género Rhizophora (mangle rojo), donde también se tomaron muestras (cinco réplicas) de sedimento por localidad (figura 3); en cada sesión de muestreo se recopilaron muestras de agua (cinco réplicas) en ubicaciones cercanas a aquellas en las cuales se obtuvieron las Pianguas y se registraron los respectivos valores de salinidad, temperatura, oxígeno disuelto (mg./l) y pH por medio de una sonda multiparamétrica marca Thermo Scientific STARA 3260. Las muestras de sedimento se guardaron en bolsas Ziploc medianas y las de agua en tubos Falcon graduados de 100 ml., y se dispusieron directamente en una cava isotérmica con hielo para su transporte al buque. Las muestras de Piangua se trasladaron en vivo para la extracción del tejido vivo en el laboratorio.

La identificación taxonómica y diferenciación de las dos especies de Piangua se realizó siguiendo las pautas brindadas por Fischer et al. (1995). En el laboratorio del buque se procedió al registro de variables morfométricas de la Piangua diferenciando entre las dos especies presentes en la zona. Las medidas registradas comprendieron la longitud de las valvas, su ancho y altura, las cuales se tomaron con ayuda de un vernier metálico con precisión de 0,01 mm. Las medidas de longitud y ancho de las valvas se registraron siguiendo las pautas brindadas por Cano (2011), mientras que la altura se tomó a partir del punto medio del umbo hasta el límite inferior de las valvas, siguiendo la línea de las costillas radiales centrales del umbo.

Posteriormente, se procedió a lavar las conchas de las Pianguas con abundante agua dulce para retirar los restos de sedimento y otras partículas que pudieran contaminar las muestras. Seguidamente, se procedió a abrir las conchas con ayuda de un cuchillo de cocina convencional y a retirar el tejido vivo por medio de un bisturí, el cual fue depositado en bolsas Ziploc debidamente rotuladas. Este procedimiento se realizó utilizando guantes de disección y tapabocas para evitar la contaminación de las muestras.

Una vez extraídas las muestras de tejidos blandos de la Piangua, cada bolsa rotulada por estación de muestreo se guardó en una bolsa Ziploc grande junto con las respectivas muestras de agua y sedimentos, para ser almacenada en un congelador acondicionado en el buque para tal fin. Al finalizar la fase de campo a bordo del buque, se procedió a empacar las muestras congeladas en una cava isotérmica con bloques de gel refrigerante que fueron facilitados a los investigadores por el personal del laboratorio del CIOH Pacífico, para poder realizar el transporte en avión hasta el laboratorio de microbiología de la Universidad del Sinú – Seccional Cartagena.

results.purpose: Caracterizar y cuantificar aislados bacterianos presentes en agua, sedimento y tejidos blandos de la Piangua (Anadara tuberculosa y Anadara similis), siguiendo un gradiente ambiental entre la población de Tumaco hasta la localidad de Candelilla de la Mar, y establecer su potencial como bioindicador, su capacidad de biorremediación o su condición patógena para humanos.

results.title: Anfibios y reptiles de la expedición en el páramo de Pisba, Boyacá - Proyecto Boyacá BIO
results.description: Bajo el convenio especial de cooperación No. 17-170 entre la gobernación del departamento de Boyacá y el Instituto Alexander von Humboldt se realizó a cabo una evaluación biológica y ecológica rápida en el páramo de Pisba en el departamento de Boyacá, se realizaron muestreos de biodiversidad de diferentes grupos biológicos, en este recurso se presentan los resultados de anfibios y reptiles. Se obtuvo un total de 51 registros biológico (34 anfibios y 17 reptiles) distribuidos en 6 especies (4 especies de anfibios y 2 especies de reptiles).

taxonomicCoverages.description: Se obtuvo un total de 51 registros biológicos de 10 especies. La taxonomía de las especies registradas sigue la propuesta por Frost, Darrel R. (2019) para anfibios y Uetz et al. (2019) para reptiles.

geographicCoverages.description: En esta expedición en el páramo de Pisba se muestreo el municipio de Tasco en el departamento de Boyacá.

project.title: Análisis de la biodiversidad y los servicios ecosistémicos para su aplicación en la toma de decisiones en el departamento de Boyacá
project.funding: Boyacá BIO. Convenio especial de cooperación No. 17-170 del 2017. Aunar esfuerzos, capacidades y competencias entre el departamento de Boyacá y el Instituto de Investigación de Recursos Biológicos Alexander von Humboldt para la ejecución del proyecto “Análisis de la biodiversidad y los servicios ecosistémicos para su aplicación en la toma de decisiones en el departamento de Boyacá” en cumplimiento de la meta “Expediciones científicas para inventariar la fauna, flora y microorganismos a nivel taxonómico y genético realizadas, mediante Acuerdo N 055 del 7 de marzo de 2017
project.studyAreaDescription: Municipios del departamento de Boyacá

samplingDescription.studyExtent: Páramo de Pisba en el municipio de Tasco en el departamento de Boyacá. Cubriendo un gradiente altitudinal entre los 3160 m y 3790 m de altitud, abarcando bosque altoandino y páramo. Los muestreos se llevaron a cabo en quebradas, charcos, pastizales rocosos, frailejonales, pajonales de Calamagrostis sp. y arbustos en las veredas Calle arriba, Calle grande, Llano grande y Santa Barbara en el municipio de Tasco.
samplingDescription.sampling: Para la caracterización de la herpetofauna presente en el Páramo de Ocetá, llevamos a cabo muestreos diurnos y nocturnos implementando tres estrategias de colecta: 1) búsqueda libre por registro visual (Heyer et al., 1994), 2) registro acústico (Angulo et al., 2006) con obtención de voucher y 3) método de remoción de rocas y troncos. Para la obtención de los ejemplares se usaron equipos de mallas de mano para los estados larvales y ejemplares adultos de difícil consecución. Para los registros individuales se obtuvieron las coordenadas geográficas y sus elevaciones correspondientes usando un GPS Garmin GPSMAP 60CSx (datum WGS 84). También se registraron datos de historia natural (ej: hábitat, comportamientos) de los individuos colectados. Los individuos fueron sacrificados, fijados y preservados usando el protocolo de Simmons (2002).
methodSteps: Se realizó la búsqueda de anfibios y reptiles durante jornadas diurnas y nocturnas. Todos los registros obtenidos fueron georreferenciados con coordenadas y altitud. Adicionalmente se registraron apuntes de hábitat y comportamiento de los individuos en campo. Los individuos fueron transportados en bolsas de tela y bolsas plásticas hacia el campamento.
En el campamento, los individuos fueron fotografiados en vida y posteriormente sacrificados con xilocaina 2% en crema para el caso de anfibios y liquida  para el caso de reptiles.
Se obtuvieron muestras de tejidos (preferiblemente hígado o músculo) para la mayoría de los ejemplares colectados. Las muestras de tejidos fueron preservadas en alcohol al 96%.
Los ejemplares fueron fijados en Formol analítico al 10% y transportados en un recipiente hermético al Instituto Alexander von Humboldt, Sede Villa de Leyva.
Una vez en el Instituto Alexander von Humboldt, se pasaron los ejemplares a agua con el fin de retirar el formol. Posteriormente los ejemplares fueron preservados en alcohol al 70%.
Se corroboraron las determinaciones taxonómicas usando revisiones y claves. Posteriormente se realizó el archivo de migración de datos con la información correspondiente a cada ejemplar.
Los ejemplares fueron catalogados e ingresados a la colección de anfibios (IAvH-AM) y reptiles (IAvH-R).

project.title: programa de monitoreo del pnn gorgona
project.studyAreaDescription: Se realiza en el PNN Gorgona, alrededor de las islas de Gorgona y Gorgonilla. temperatura promdedio de 27 grados, esta 0m sobre el nivel del mar. El area protegida tiene 61687.5 hectareas
project.designDescription: El indicador busca detectar cambios en el número de individuos de la población de Sula leucogaster, Sula nebouxi, Fregata magnifecens y Pelecaus occidentalis mensualmente. La densidad estas especies son un buen indicador del estado de salud de las comunidades terrestres e indirectamente del intercambio energético entre el mar y las comunidades terrestres

samplingDescription.studyExtent: Se realiza en el PNN Gorgona, alrededor de las islas de Gorgona y Gorgonilla. temperatura promdedio de 27 grados, esta 0m sobre el nivel del mar. El area protegida tiene 61687.5 hectareas
samplingDescription.sampling: Los censos se hicieron la primera semana de cada mes durante dos días en las primeras horas de la mañana en zonas norte y sur con 2 observadores en lancha cerca de la costa con 4 transecto en zona norte y 3 en la zona sur
samplingDescription.qualityControl: georreferenciacion, taxonomia y validacion tecnica de los equipos local y territorial
methodSteps: El monitoreo de aves marinas se realiza para cuatro especies de aves: El Pelícano Café (Pelecanus occidentalis), Fragata Común (Fregata magnificens), especies que se encuentran principalmente en el bosque del islote Gorgonilla y el Piquero Café (Sula leucogaster) y el Piquero Patiazul (Sula nebouxii) que se encuentran en los promontorios rocosos alrededor de la isla Gorgona y el islote Gorgonilla. Los censos se hacen la primera semana de cada mes durante dos días en las primeras horas de la mañana, uno en la zona norte y otro en la zona sur. Para lo anterior, se debe contar con mínimo dos observadores a bordo de una lancha navegando muy cerca de la costa (riscos y acantilados entre otros). En la zona norte y sur se establecieron 4 y 3 transectos respetivamente, los cuales son recorridos para los conteos generales de las especies objeto del censo (Tabla 11 Programa de monitoreo PNN Gorgona), finalmente, en cinco transectos de 200m se realizan censos de Fragatas. Protocolo • Inicio de monitoreo 6 am • El equipo de trabajo conformado por dos observadores y tripulación salen a bordo de una lancha desde la zona denominada El Poblado e inician el recorrido en busca de los transectos. • Previo a la llegada a los transectos se registra las condiciones ambientales: viento (1: calmado, 2: moderado, 3: fuerte), clima (seco, nublado, llovizna, lluvioso), estado del mar (1: calmado, 2: moderado, 3: fuerte), marea (puja o quiebra) y nubosidad (desde 1/8 hasta 8/8: poco nublado a muy nublado). • La velocidad de la embarcación mientras se realiza el censo no debe superar los 10 nudos/hora • Uno de los observadores se encarga de censar a los pelícanos (Pelecanus occidentalis ) y las fragatas (Fregata magnificens). • El segundo observador se encarga de censar a los individuos del Piqueros Café (Sula leucogaster etesiaca) y Piquero Patas Azules (Sula nebouxii) • Se efectúa el conteo y registro de las cuatro especies. • Adicionalmente se toma información de la actividad que está realizando el individuo (vuelo, perchado). • Para las aves en vuelo, solo se toman en cuenta a los individuos que van en dirección contraria al bote para evitar el reconteo. • Finalmente, se registra el tiempo de recorrido por cada transecto.

results.title: Camera_trapping_vertebrates_azores
results.description: The present publication provides a data set from five camera-trapping sampling campaigns on two islands of the Azorean archipelago (Pico and Terceira islands). Between 2013 and 2018, two sampling campaigns were conducted on Terceira island ("TER_13-15" survey) and on Terceira and Pico islands ("TER-PIC_18" survey) aimed to study the ecology of introduced mammals. A third sampling campaign was performed between 2015 and 2017 sampling was performed in vineyards on Terceira island in order to evaluate grape consumption by vertebrates species ("Vineyards_15-17" survey). Additionally, between 2016 and 2018, two sampling campaigns were performed in Terceira island, in order to assess the impact of introduced mammals on native birds, on Cory's Shearwater (Calonectris diomedea borealis; "Calonectris_16" survey) and the Azores woodpigeon (Columba palumba azorica; "Columba_17-18" survey), through nest predation monitoring. A total of 258 sites and 47 nests were sampled using camera traps. These sampling campaigns provided a large data series that allowed create a vertebrate wildlife inventory of Azores

citation.text: Lamelas-López L, Pardavila X, Amorim I, Borges P A (2019). Camera_trapping_vertebrates_azores. Universidade dos Açores. Sampling event dataset https://doi.org/10.15468/tcmnya accessed via GBIF.org on 2019-10-21.

project.title: Wildlife inventory from camera-trapping surveys in the Azores (Pico and Terceira islands)
project.funding: LLL was supported by a grant from Fundação para a Ciência e Tecnologia - FCT (SFRH/BD/115022/2016). Open access was funded by FEDER (85%) and by Azorean Public funds (15%), through the Operational Program Azores 2020 under the project AZORESBIOPORTAL – PORBIOTA (ACORES-01-0145-FEDER-000072).
project.studyAreaDescription: Terceira (area: 400.6 km²; elevation: 1,021 m.a.s.l.) and Pico (area: 444.8 km²; elevation: 2351 m.a.s.l.) islands are two of the nine islands from the Azores archipelago, located in the North Atlantic. The climate in the Azores is temperate oceanic, with regular and abundant rainfall, with high levels of relative humidity and persistent winds. The landscape is relatively similar in all islands of the archipelago, with urban and rural areas being concentrated near the coast, at the lowest elevations. At intermediate elevations, the dominant land cover types include crops, pasturelands, and exotic tree plantations of the Japanese cedar (Cryptomeria japonica) and Australian cheesewood (Pittosporum undulatum). The native vegetation remnants are found at the highest elevations and in the most inaccessible areas.
project.designDescription:
This dataset was obtained from different sampling campaigns performed between 2013 and 2018 in two islands of the central group of the Azores archipelago, Pico and Terceira Islands. 

We described the study extent of the different sampling campaigns below:
•	The survey "TER_13-15" was conducted between 2013 and 2015 on Terceira island to investigate the ecology of introduced mammals. A total of 72 sites were sampled, but five sites were excluded due to camera failures. Each site was sampled during seven consecutive days.
•	The survey "PIC-TER_18" was conduced in 2018, on Pico and Terceira islands to investigate the ecology of introduced mammals. A total of 69 sites were sampled, with 33 and 34 sites located in Pico and Terceira islands, respectively. Each site was sampled during ten consecutive days.
•	The survey "Vineyards_15-17" was conduced in three consecutive years (2015, 2016 and 2017) in a vineyards area known as Protected Landscape Area of "Vinhas dos Biscoitos", located in the North of Terceira island, to evaluate grape consumption by vertebrates. A total of 117 sites were sampled, with 20, 49 and 48 sites sampled during 2015, 2016 and 2017, respectively. Each site was sampled during seven consecutive days.
•	The survey "Calonectris_16" was conducted in 2016, on Terceira island to asses the impact of introduced mammals. A total of 17 nests of Calonectris diomedea borealis were sampled. Each nest was sampled during ten consecutive days.
•	The survey "Columba_17-18" was conducted in 2017 and 2018, on Terceira island to assess the impact of introduced mammals. A total of 30 nests of Columba palumbus azorica were sampled, with 9 and 21 sites sampled in 2017 and 2018, respectively. Each nest was sampled during ten consecutive days.

All sites were sampled using camera traps, which were fixed to a tree or wooden stick. Sampling effort was measured as camera-traps days, i.e., the number of camera traps multiplied by the number of days that they remained active. The sensitivity of the infrared sensor was configured to high to increase the species detection. Cameras were configured to take events with 30 seconds of delay between them, recording the date and time of each event. Cameras remained active 24 hours per day. 
For the surveys "TER_13-15" and "PIC-TER_18" sampling sites were randomly selected, separated at least by 1 km. In each sampling site one camera trap and a bait were deployed, 150-200 cm apart. Bait, consisting of meat or fish, fruit or vegetables and molasses, was used to increase the species detection.
For the surveys "Vineyards_15-17", "Calonectris_16" and "Columba_17-18" no bait was used. In the case of the "Vineyards_15-17" survey, sampling sites were selected at random, deploying one camera per each site, facing bunches of grapes. For "Calonectris_16" and "Columba_17-18" surveys, one camera was installed at 50-150 cm from the study nest.
project.abstract: The present publication provides a data set from five camera-trapping sampling campaigns on two islands of the Azorean archipelago (Pico and Terceira islands). Between 2013 and 2018, two sampling campaigns were conducted on Terceira island ("TER_13-15" survey) and on Terceira and Pico islands ("TER-PIC_18" survey) aimed to study the ecology of introduced mammals. A third sampling campaign was performed between 2015 and 2017 sampling was performed in vineyards on Terceira island in order to evaluate grape consumption by vertebrates species ("Vineyards_15-17" survey). Additionally, between 2016 and 2018, two sampling campaigns were performed in Terceira island, in order to assess the impact of introduced mammals on native birds, on Cory's Shearwater (Calonectris diomedea borealis; "Calonectris_16" survey) and the Azores woodpigeon (Columba palumba azorica; "Columba_17-18" survey), through nest predation monitoring. A total of 258 sites and 47 nests were sampled using camera traps. These sampling campaigns provided a large data series that allowed create a vertebrate wildlife inventory of Azores.

We described the study extent of the different sampling campaigns below:
•	The survey "TER_13-15" was conducted between 2013 and 2015 on Terceira island to investigate the ecology of introduced mammals. A total of 72 sites were sampled, but five sites were excluded due to camera failures. Each site was sampled during seven consecutive days.
•	The survey "PIC-TER_18" was conduced in 2018, on Pico and Terceira islands to investigate the ecology of introduced mammals. A total of 69 sites were sampled, with 33 and 34 sites located in Pico and Terceira islands, respectively. Each site was sampled during ten consecutive days.
•	The survey "Vineyards_15-17" was conduced in three consecutive years (2015, 2016 and 2017) in a vineyards area known as Protected Landscape Area of "Vinhas dos Biscoitos", located in the North of Terceira island, to evaluate grape consumption by vertebrates. A total of 117 sites were sampled, with 20, 49 and 48 sites sampled during 2015, 2016 and 2017, respectively. Each site was sampled during seven consecutive days.
•	The survey "Calonectris_16" was conducted in 2016, on Terceira island to asses the impact of introduced mammals. A total of 17 nests of Calonectris diomedea borealis were sampled. Each nest was sampled during ten consecutive days.
•	The survey "Columba_17-18" was conducted in 2017 and 2018, on Terceira island to assess the impact of introduced mammals. A total of 30 nests of Columba palumbus azorica were sampled, with 9 and 21 sites sampled in 2017 and 2018, respectively. Each nest was sampled during ten consecutive days.
samplingDescription.sampling:
All sites were sampled using camera traps, which were fixed to a tree or wooden stick. Sampling effort was measured as camera-traps days, i.e., the number of camera traps multiplied by the number of days that they remained active (Rovero et al. 2010). The sensitivity of the infrared sensor was configured to high to increase the species detection (O’Connell et al. 2011). Cameras were configured to take events with 30 seconds of delay between them, recording the date and time of each event. Cameras remained active 24 hours per day. 
For the surveys "TER_13-15" and "PIC-TER_18" sampling sites were randomly selected, separated at least by 1 km. In each sampling site one camera trap and a bait were deployed, 150-200 cm apart. Bait, consisting of meat or fish, fruit or vegetables and molasses, was used to increase the species detection (du Preez et al. 2014).
For the surveys "Vineyards_15-17", "Calonectris_16" and "Columba_17-18" no bait was used. In the case of the "Vineyards_15-17" survey, sampling sites were selected at random, deploying one camera per each site, facing bunches of grapes. For "Calonectris_16" and "Columba_17-18" surveys, one camera was installed at 50-150 cm from the study nest.
methodSteps: The data has been published as a Darwin Core Archive (DwC-A), which is a standardised format for sharing biodiversity data as a set of one or more data tables. The core data table (events) contains 2,308 records and one data table extension also exists (occurrence), with 108,186 records. The extension supplies extra information about the core record.

project.title: Monitoring and conservation of rare species of fungi in the Eastern Ukraine
project.studyAreaDescription: Ukraine
project.abstract:
Goal: Fungi are widely used as surrogate species to evaluate and declare “conservational value” of forest areas in Europe. The same approach could be used in the broadleaved forests of the Eastern Ukraine. Developing a set of umbrella and flagship species of fungi, characteristic for this region, can be used to simplify evaluation procedures, as well as raise awareness about the role of dead wood in supporting biodiversity.
1) Pleurotus calyptratus (Agaricales, Basidiomycota) is a fungus which is a rare and highly conservational evaluated in Western and Northern Europe. On the contrary, P. calyptratus is occasional to almost common in some habitats in Ukraine. We aim to study its ecological strategy, which would help to estimate the danger of extinction and to evaluate its status.
2) Additionally, our project includes monitoring of Sarcoscypha spp. and Urnula craterium cup fungi, which inhabit fine woody debris. These were selected due to their noticeable fruitbodies, well-defined fruitification period (early spring), as well as their Red-listed or otherwise protected status in neighborhood European countries. Despite species of Sarcoscypha genus are difficult to distinguish in oculo nudo, they apparently have similar ecological preferences, keeping the possibility of using them for conservation purposes.

samplingDescription.studyExtent: Eastern Ukraine
samplingDescription.sampling: Part of records, included herein, have been obtained using distance sampling method (Buckland et al., 2001). Distance sampling was perfomed in 2 study plots (young and old oak forest), in 2013 and 2019 years in the National Nature Park “Homilshansky lisy”. One researcher followed a strait transect and detected all groups of Urnula and Sarcoscypha fruitbodies, and other one measured and noticed a distance to a fruitbody/group of fruitbodies, and number of fruitbodies in a group. The method further will be detailed in forthcoming publications.
methodSteps: Direct observations of fungal fruit bodies on casual routs; observations on the permanent transects with recording of the distance from transect to groups of fruit bodies.

results.title: Butterfly observations data. Monitoring butterflies in the Sierra Nevada (Granada, Spain)
results.description:
Dataset contains Lepidoptera observations made along established transects carried out in 2019. These observations were carried out as part of the larger monitoring schema "monitoring butterflies in the Sierra Nevada (Granada, Spain)". The main objectives of this project are 1) to record the population trend of the species being monitored, 2) to record the phenological patterns of each species and the possible changes that they may suffer due to climate changes 3) to identify variables related to the distribution and abundance of these species and, finally, 4) to establish an early warning system that allows managers to implement adaptive management measures on these species and their ecosystems.

This dataset is a port of a dataset created, published and hosted by iEcolab (Instituto Interuniversitario de Investigación del Sistema Tierra en Andalucía, Granada, Spain). It has been prepared to explore discoverability and interoperability issues related to LTER data and data publishing platforms such as DEIMS (https://deims.org/) and Eudat (https://b2share.eudat.eu/). Results to be presented at the "Biodiversity Next" Conference,, Leiden Oct 2019. https://doi.org/10.3897/biss.3.37257

results.title: EDP Foz-Tua: Large Mammals (camera-trapping): Complementary Studies [2010]
results.description: The dataset contains records of large mammals (Mammalia) collected in the lower valley of the River Tua and included in the Complementary Studies (2010) of the Environmental Impact Assessment of the Foz Tua Hydroelectric Dam, promoted by EDP – Energias de Portugal, S.A. Data were collected between February and March 2010 with 40 cameras in sampling points with favourable habitats in 20 2x2 km UTM squares on the area of the lower Tua river valley directly or indirectly affected by the Foz-Tua dam. The presence of individuals and the species identification was recorded by direct observation of the photos taken with the cameras.

citation.text: Cabral J A, Barros P, Vale-Gonçalves H M, Santos R, Múrias T (2019). EDP Foz-Tua: Large Mammals (camera-trapping): Complementary Studies [2010]. EDP - Energias de Portugal. Sampling event dataset https://doi.org/10.15468/czpjfa accessed via GBIF.org on 2019-10-21.

project.title: EDP Foz-Tua: Large Mammals (camera-trapping): Complementary Studies [2010]
project.funding: The work was funded by EDP - Energias de Portugal, S.A.
project.studyAreaDescription: The study was conducted in part of the sub-basins of river Tua, prior to the construction and subsequent flooding of the lower part of this river’s valley by the Foz-Tua Hydroelectric Dam. The sampling was centered in suitable habitats for large mammals in each 2x2 km UTM squares found in a 5 km radius buffer around the future reservoir banks and up to 35 km from the Tua mouth.
project.designDescription: The objective of the study was to characterize the large mammals fauna in a buffer of 5 km around the Tua lower valley before the dam construction, and to gather quality data to support the design and implementation of mitigation and/or compensation measures. The camera trapping was used to complement the classic transect methods.
project.abstract: The dataset contains records of large mammals (Mammalia) collected in plots along the lower Tua River, and included in the Complementary Studies of the Environmental Impact Assessment of the Foz Tua Hydroelectric Dam, promoted by EDP – Energias de Portugal, S.A. Data were collected between February and March 2010, with 40 cameras (two cameras/2x2 km UTM squares) in sampling plots with favourable habitats for large mammals within a 5-km buffer around the River Tua lower valley. The occurrence of the target taxa was documented through 216 observation events in 40 sampling points. In total, four taxa were identified to species rank. The most abundant species (> 90 records) were Martes foina (113) and Genetta genetta (96).

samplingDescription.studyExtent: The data were collected within a 5-km buffer around the Tua lower valley (Northeast Portugal), up to 35 km from the mouth, in the municipalities of Carrazeda de Ansiães, Alijó, Murça, Vila Flor and Mirandela.
samplingDescription.sampling: Sampling was designed to cover the main habitat types for large mammals in and around the lower Tua valley affected by the Foz-Tua dam (including the reservoir area). Two digital cameras with motion sensor and infrared iluminator were set in each 2x2 km UTM square over a period of three days and three nights. Baits (a mixture of meat and sardine oil) were set 2-4 m from the cameras to attract potential mammals. The machines were programmed to shoot a video of 15 seconds and shoot two pictures with a delay of 1 minute after the activation. All cameras were inspected after each 3-day period of exposition. Species identification and assessment of age and sex (when possible) were made by visual observation of the pictures taken.
samplingDescription.qualityControl: All identifications were performed by qualified technicians
methodSteps: To be completed

results.title: EDP Foz-Tua: Large and Medium-sized Mammals (occasional observations): Complementary Studies [2009-10]
results.description: The dataset contains records of large and medium-sized mammals (Mammalia: Carnivora, Chiroptera, Cetartiodactyla and Lagomorpha) collected in the lower valley of the River Tua, and included in the Complementary Studies (2009-10) of the Environmental Impact Assessment of the Foz Tua Hydroelectric Dam, promoted by EDP – Energias de Portugal, S.A.  Data were collected between November 2009 and March 2010 in a non-systematic way in 20 2x2 km UTM squares on the area of the lower Tua valley directly or indirectly affected by the Foz Tua dam. The presence of individuals was recorded mainly through the detection presence signs such as scats, tracks, etc.

project.title: EDP Foz Tua Large and Medium-sized Mammals (occasional observations) - Complementary Studies  [2009-10]
project.funding: The work was funded by EDP - Energias de Portugal, S.A.
project.studyAreaDescription: The study was conducted in part of the sub-basins of river Tua, prior to the construction and subsequent flooding of the lower part of this river valley by the Foz-Tua Hydroelectric Dam. The sampling was centered in suitable habitats for the target species found in a 5-km radius buffer around the future reservoir banks, and up to 35 km from the Tua mouth.
project.designDescription: The objective of the study was to characterize the fauna of large and medium-sized mammals in a buffer of 5 km around the Tua lower valley before the dam construction, and to gather quality data to support the design and implementation of mitigation and/or compensation measures. This dataset includes all non-systematic observations of the presence of the target species collected during the large mammal surveys, but outside the sampling points/transects and/or during other vertebrate fauna surveys.
project.abstract:
The dataset contains records of large and medium-sized mammals (Mammalia: Carnivora, Chiroptera, Cetartiodactyla and Lagomorpha) collected in plots along the lower Tua River, and included in the Complementary Studies of the Environmental Impact Assessment of the Foz Tua Hydroelectric Dam, promoted by EDP – Energias de Portugal, S.A. Data were collected between November 2009 and March 2010, in a non-systematic way in 20x20 km UTM squares, within a 5-km buffer around the lower Tua River valley. 
The occurrence of the target taxa was documented through 74 observation events in 64 sampling points. In total, nine taxa were identified to species rank. The most abundant species (>10 individuals/signs of presence) were Sus scrofa (30) and Vulpes vulpes (24).

samplingDescription.studyExtent: The data were collected within a 5-km buffer around the lower Tua River valley (Northeast Portugal) up to 35 km from the mouth, in the municipalities of Carrazeda de Ansiães, Alijó, Vila Flor, Murça and Mirandela.
samplingDescription.sampling: No standardized sampling was used. All observations made outside the sampled points/transects for large mammals and/or during surveys of other vertebrates were recorded and collected here. The identification and species assessment methods were those used for the large mammals regular surveys: indirect signs of presence (scats, tracks) or observations of live individuals (only at night).
samplingDescription.qualityControl: All identifications were performed by qualified technicians.

results.title: Estudio de la Diversidad de Microorganismos de Ambientes Termales y Salinos de la Región Andina Central de Colombia
results.description:
Estructura de la comunidad microbiana de manantiales termales del Departamento de Boyacá. Este estudio se realizó en 5 manantiales termales y un manantial salino de Boyacá. Las comunidades microbianas de los manantiales están conformadas principalmente por poblaciones termofílicas de organismos sulfato-reductores, tiosulfato-reductores no sulfato-reductores, organismos reductores de hierro férrico, organismos reductores de nitratos y principalmente organismos fermentativos.

Composición de la comunidad microbiana de manantiales termales del Departamento de Risaralda. Se concentró en el estudio de la diversidad microbiana de manantiales salinos y termales del departamento de Risaralda. Los estudios en esta segunda fase se orientaron hacia la clasificación taxonómica de microorganismos, utilizando como marcador molecular el gen 16S rRNA, con el fin de identificar los microorganismos presentes en manantiales salinos y termales.

citation.text: Baena S, Diaz Cardenas C, López Ramirez G (2019). Estudio de la Diversidad de Microorganismos de Ambientes Termales y Salinos de la Región Andina Central de Colombia. Version 1.1. project.title: ESTUDIO DE LA DIVERSIDAD DE MICROORGANISMOS DE AMBIENTES TERMALES Y SALINOS DE LA REGION ANDINA CENTRAL DE COLOMBIA
project.funding: Pontificia Universidad Javeriana, IFS y Colciencias
project.studyAreaDescription: Este estudio se desarrolló en dos fases, una primera concentrada en cinco manantiales termales y un manantial salino del departamento de Boyacá, a 2.500 m.s.n.m. en el Departamento de Boyacá y una segunda fase de estudio que se concentró en el estudio de la diversidad microbiana de manantiales salinos y termales del departamento de Risaralda. Los estudios en esta segunda fase se orientaron hacia la clasificación taxonómica de microorganismos, utilizando como marcador molecular el gen 16S rRNA, con el fin de identificar los microorganismos presentes en manantiales salinos y termales.
project.designDescription: Este estudio se desarrolló en dos fases, una primera concentrada en cinco manantiales termales y un manantial salino del departamento de Boyacá, a 2.500 m.s.n.m. en el Departamento de Boyacá. y una segunda en el departamento de Risaralda, donde se seleccionaron cuatro manantiales, dos termales (Jaivana y Parador de Quimbaya y dos salinos (Manantial Salado de Consotá y Manantial La Cristalina). En cada manantial se ubicaron diferentes puntos de muestreo y se tomaron muestras a diferentes profundidades, según el manantial en estudio y se realizaron 3 muestreos durante dos años de estudio.
project.abstract:
Los objetivos de este estudio fueron: 
1.Establecer una colección microbiana de organismos termofilicos y halofilicos utilizando herramientas de taxonomía y filogenia molecular. 
2. Describir la composición de las comunidades microbianas de los Dominios Archaea y Bacteria de manantiales salinos y manantiales termales de los departamentos de Boyacá y Risaralda y su relación con las condiciones fisicoquímicas de su ambiente. 
3. Describir fenotípica y genotípicamente los microorganismos aislados de estos ambientes termales y salinos e identificar nuevas especies usando características quimio taxonómicas como análisis de ácidos grasos de pared celular, lípidos de membrana y génicas como contenido de guanina-citosina del DNA total y secuenciación del genoma con fines taxonómicos y filogenómicos.

samplingDescription.studyExtent:
Este estudio se desarrolló en dos fases, una primera concentrada en cinco manantiales termales y un manantial salino del departamento de Boyacá, a 2.500 m.s.n.m. en el Departamento de Boyacá. Una segunda fase de estudio, que se concentró
en el estudio de la diversidad microbiana de manantiales salinos y termales del departamento de Risaralda.
samplingDescription.sampling: En cada manantial se ubicaron diferentes puntos de muestreo y se tomaron muestras a diferentes profundidades, según el manantial en estudio y se realizaron 3 muestreos durante dos años de estudio
samplingDescription.qualityControl: En cada manantial se ubicaron diferentes puntos de muestreo y se tomaron muestras a diferentes profundidades, según el manantial en estudio y se realizaron 3 muestreos durante dos años de estudio
methodSteps: Para el aislamiento e identificación fenotípica y genotípica de los microorganismos dominantes de los manantiales se tomaron muestras puntuales entre 200 y 500 ml de agua y sedimento en frascos estériles a profundidades entre 30 y 100 cm según las características de cada manantial. Posteriormente (menos de 24 horas) se realizaron las siembras en diferentes series de cultivo, siguiendo protocolos descritos previamente. Las muestras fueron procesadas en el laboratorio de la Unidad de Saneamiento y Biotecnología Ambiental (USBA) de la Universidad Javeriana. Para el aislamiento de los microorganismos se realizaron 31 series de cultivo en condiciones anaerobias y 24 series de cultivo en condiciones aerobias. Las diferentes series de cultivo se definieron con base en las características de cada manantial y con base en el tipo de microorganismo que se deseaba aislar. Se tuvo en cuenta la fuente de carbono (donador de electrones en la mayoría de los casos) y la presencia o ausencia de aceptor de electrones, y se incubaron también según las características de cada manantial. A partir de las diferentes series de cultivo se realizaron los aislamientos microbianos en medio sólido con agar noble al 2% (p/v) usando la técnica del tubo rodado. La purificación de los microorganismos se logró con el uso repetido de esta técnica hasta obtener cultivos axénicos. La pureza de los cultivos fue verificada por observación al microscopio y repicaje en medio enriquecido con extracto de levadura (2g/l) y glucosa (20 mM).

results.title: Specimen references on the Verbenaceae family held by the TAN Herbarium
results.description:
The Tsimbazaza Park was created in August 29th, 1925 in the city of Antananarivo, capital of Madagascar. Initially it was named the "Botanical Garden of Tananarive" consisting of thematic areas. In 1935, the construction of animal cages and breeding in captivity began. His name has changed "Parc Botanique et Zoologique de Tananarive". In 1947, it was the only "National Research Center" in Madagascar and worked in collaboration with the Overseas Scientific and Technical Research Office (ORSTOM). In 1993 after having its status, it took the name "Parc Botanique et Zoologique de Tsimbazaza (PBZT)" until today and under the supervision of the Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research. It is made up of four departments: Fauna, Flora, Environmental Conservation Education and finally Administrative and Financial.

The TAN Herbarium belongs to the Flora Department, particularly at the Herbarium Division. It is one of the three national reference Herbaria existing in Madagascar. The Herbarium Room was created around 1950. The first extension, funded by the Winslow Foundation with the help of the Missouri Botanical Garden, was made in 2004. Currently, it is the largest herbarium of the western Indian Ocean. The TAN herbarium consists of three rooms and two storage rooms. It contains Angiosperms, Gymnosperms, Ferns, Mosses and some species of Lichen. The oldest known collection is dated from 1831. The total number of herbarium specimens to be conserved is estimated to 258,000 of which 200,000 are mounted with 177,000 classified in the cabinets and 23,000 unclassified and the remaining 50,000 are unmounted. Currently 850 type specimens were recorded. The Herbarium TAN is one of the largest places that conserves the biodiversity of Madagascar. It is a laboratory where researchers and students draw information for their work. Each year, there are at least twenty students doing their internships.

This part will concern the Verbenacea family sensus lato (e.g. with the species which were formerly included to it but now migrated to the Lamiaceae).

citation.text: Letsara R, Ranaivo J (2019). Specimen references on the Verbenaceae family held by the TAN Herbarium. Parc Botanique et Zoologique de Tsimbazaza (P.B.Z.T.). Occurrence dataset https://doi.org/10.15468/tqr4ip accessed via GBIF.org on 2019-10-21.

project.title: Mobilization of reference specimens data on the Verbenaceae family at TAN herbarium
project.funding: The digitization of this family has been possible thanks to the European Union funding through the BID program coordinated by GBIF.
project.studyAreaDescription:
Invasive alien species and endangered species were the two first of the eight priority areas defined by the ACM in each WP 2015 - 2016. In this regards the consortium retained eight families of each category for the project. 
The Verbenaceae family was choosen by the consortium as one of the priority family of the invasive species.
project.designDescription:
Invasive alien species and endangered species were the two first of the eight priority areas defined by the ACM in each WP 2015 - 2016. In this regards the consortium retained eight families of each category for the project. 
The Verbenaceae family was choosen by the consortium as one of the priority family of the invasive species. The species formerely belonging to the Verbenaceae family but now migrated to Lamiaceae is included in the database.
project.abstract: The digitizing of the plant reference specimens of TAN Herbarium was initiated during SEP-CEPDEC 1, the BID program allowed to continue the digitization of some threatened and invasive species (https://www.gbif.org/project/82750/capacity-building-and-biodiversity-data-mobilization-for-conservation-and-policy-in-africa.)

samplingDescription.studyExtent: This digitization concerns the Verbenaceae family sens lato (e.g. with the species formerely included to but now migrated to Lamiaceae) specimens mainly collected in Madagascar and conserved at the TAN Herbarium.
samplingDescription.sampling: All the specimens are systematically recorded
methodSteps: The digitization was done by the PBZT staff who performed as well nomenclatural checking using APNI. Further quality checking was carried out by MadBIF staff who formated also the data to DwC. The scientific names were submitted to TNRS application and those which were not fully validated were checked with Catalogue of life, Tropicos and Plantlist. When any of these databases do not validate the given lowermost taxonomic rank scientific name, we adopt the rank of the lowermost validated name as taxonRank, however, we keep the given identification name.

results.title: Epifitas del piedemonte de Yopal
results.description: Este recurso contiene la información de epifitas presentes en el área de ampliación del EPF Floreña, ubicada en el corregimiento del Morro, municipio de Yopal, departamento de Casanare, Colombia. Estas epifitas fueron rescatadas y posteriormente trasladadas. Los grupos taxonómicos rescatados fueron epifitas vasculares (filo: Tracheophyta) de las familias Bromeliaceae y Orchidaceae, y epifitas no vasculares: líquenes (filo: Ascomyta), musgos (filo: Bryophyta), hepáticas (filo: Marchiantiophyta).

citation.text: Ramírez Correal B H (2019). Epifitas del piedemonte de Yopal. Asociación de Becarios del Casanare - ABC. Occurrence dataset https://doi.org/10.15472/ijipke accessed via GBIF.org on 2019-10-21.

taxonomicCoverages.description: Este proyecto se enfocó en epifitas vasculares (Orquídeas y Bromelias) y no vasculares (Bryophytas y Líquenes)

project.title: Traslado de epifitas para la ampliación del EPF Floreña
project.funding: Equión Energía Limited
project.studyAreaDescription: La ampliación del EPF Floreña se dio en el corregimiento de El Morro. La ubicación está en la micro cuenca La Aguatoca, de la cuenca del Río Cravo Sur.
project.abstract: Este registro responde al proyecto traslado de epifitas en cumplimiento de los compromisos para levantamiento de veda otorgado por el Ministerio De Ambiente y Desarrollo Sotenible para la ampliación del EPF Floreña. El proyecto es ejecutado por ABC pero financiado por Equión Energía Limited

samplingDescription.studyExtent: El área de rescate de las epifitas está ubicada a 500 m del área de traslado, sin variaciones superiores a los 100 m en elevación. El rescate se dio en árboles ubicados en bosques secundarios de piedemonte y en árboles asilados en potreros. El traslado se realizó a bosques secundarios de piedemonte en el margen de cauce de la Quebrada Aguatoca y del Río Cravo Sur.
samplingDescription.sampling: El muestreo se realizó durante el rescate de epifitas. Todas las epifitas fueron rescatadas de árboles que iban a ser aprovechados para la ampliación del EPF.
samplingDescription.qualityControl: Las coordenadas fueron validadas en Obis Plotter, los nombres científicos se validaorn en el GBIF.
methodSteps: Se escogieron los árboles con mayor número de epifitas de los que iban a ser talados para la ampliación. Durante la tala se extrajeron epifitas manualmente o con porciones de madera. Luego se llevaorn a un epifitario temporal donde se realizó la agrupación de epifitas en morfos, se tomaron muestras de cada grupo y se enviaron al herbario nacional COL para su identificación.

results.title: Post Graduate College Bannu Herbarium
results.description: Bannu is located in Waziristan. It is a mountainous region comprising two districts, North Waziristan and South Waziristan that are now included in the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province. There are no checklists for the region, let alone a flora. It is also poorly represented in the world's herbaria, including those of Pakistan. BANNU was established in 1960 but has only recently (2017) been given the support required to make significant progress in documenting and summarizing Waziristan's florist diversity and its use by local people.

citation.text: Government Post Graduate College Bannu (2019). Post Graduate College Bannu Herbarium. Occurrence dataset https://doi.org/10.15468/lf6paa accessed via GBIF.org on 2019-10-21.

results.title: EDP Foz-Tua: Terrestrial Birds (occasional observations)- Complementary Studies [2009-10]
results.description: The dataset contains occasional records of terrestrial birds (Aves) collected in the lower valley of the River Tua, and included in the Complementary Studies (2009-2010) of the Environmental Impact Assessment of the Foz Tua Hydroelectric Dam, promoted by EDP – Energias de Portugal, S.A. Data were collected between April and May 2010 during field visits to 16 sampling points with favourable habitats in 20 2x2 km UTM squares on the area of the lower Tua river valley directly or indirectly affected by the Foz Tua dam. The occurrence of birds was recorded whenever individuals were seen or heard in the vicinity of the observer.

citation.text: Cabral J A, Travassos P, Santos R, Múrias T (2019). EDP Foz-Tua: Terrestrial Birds (occasional observations)- Complementary Studies [2009-10]. EDP - Energias de Portugal. Sampling event dataset https://doi.org/10.15468/kxfrjf accessed via GBIF.org on 2019-10-21.

project.title: EDP Foz Tua Birds (occasional observation) - Complementary Studies [2009-10]
project.funding: The work was funded by EDP - Energias de Portugal, S.A.
project.studyAreaDescription: The study was conducted in part of the sub-basins of river Tua, prior to the construction and subsequent flooding of the lower part of this river valley by the Foz Tua Hydroelectric Dam. The sampling was centered in suitable habitats for terrestrial birds found in a 5-km radius buffer around the future reservoir banks, and up to 50 km from the Tua mouth.
project.designDescription: The objective of the study was to characterize the terrestrial avifauna in a buffer of 5 km around the lower Tua River valley before the dam construction, and to gather quality data to support the design and implementation of mitigation and/or compensation measures.
project.abstract: The dataset contains occasional records of terrestrial birds (Aves) collected along the lower Tua River valley, and included in the Complementary Studies of the Environmental Impact Assessment of the Foz Tua Hydroelectric Dam, promoted by EDP – Energias de Portugal, S.A. Data were collected between December 2009 and April 2010, within the framework of independent studies performed in the area covered by the Foz-Tua Hydroelectric project (ie, within a 5-km buffer around the River Tua lower valley). The occurrence of the target taxa was documented through 165 positive observation in 65 events. In total, 65 species were identified. The most recorded species (>10 individuals) were Merops apiaster (22), Turdus merula and Serinus serinus (21), Turdus philomelos (19), Sylvia atricapilla and Fringilla coelebs (14), Erithacus rubecula and Columba palumbus (13), and Sturnus unicolor and Circaetus gallicus (12).

samplingDescription.studyExtent: The data were collected within a 5-km buffer around the lower Tua River valley (Northeast Portugal), up to 50 km from the mouth in the municipalities of Carrazeda de Ansiães,  Vila Flor,  Alijó, Murça and Mirandela.
samplingDescription.sampling: Occasional records, compiled from projects carried out in the same geographical area of the Foz Tua Dam. Species identification and assessment of age and sex (when possible) were carried out by field technicians with experience in ornithology. The identification and species assessment methods were those used for the bird regular census by point-counts.
samplingDescription.qualityControl: All identifications were performed by qualified technicians
methodSteps: To be completed

results.title: EDP Foz-Tua: Terrestrial Birds (transects) Complementary Studies [2009-10]
results.description: The dataset contains records of terrestrial birds (Aves) collected in the lower valley of the River Tua and included in the Complementary Studies (2009-2010) of the Environmental Impact Assessment of the Foz Tua Hydroelectric Dam, promoted by EDP – Energias de Portugal, S.A. Data were collected between December 2009 and April 2010 during field visits to 24 line transects with favourable habitats in 20 2x2 km UTM squares on the area of the lower Tua valley directly or indirectly affected by the Foz-Tua dam. The presence of individuals was recorded by direct (sight) and/or indirect (ear) observation.

project.title: EDP Foz Tua Terrestrial Birds (transects)  - Complementary Studies  [2009-10]
project.funding: The work was funded by EDP - Energias de Portugal, S.A.
project.studyAreaDescription: The study was conducted in part of the sub-basins of river Tua, prior to the construction and subsequent flooding of the lower part of this river’s valley by the Foz-Tua Hydroelectric Dam. The sampling was centered in suitable habitats for terrestrial birds found in a 5 km radius buffer around the future reservoir banks and up to 50 km from the Tua mouth.
project.designDescription: The study was a complement (using a different methodology) to the previous characterization of the terrestrial avifauna in a buffer of 5 km around the Tua lower valley  before the dam construction, and to gather quality data to support the design and implementation of mitigation and/or compensation measures.
project.abstract: The dataset contains records of terrestrial birds (Aves) collected in transects along the lower Tua River, and included in the Complementary Studies of the Environmental Impact Assessment of the Foz Tua Hydroelectric Dam, promoted by EDP – Energias de Portugal, S.A. Data were collected between December 2009 and April 2010, during field visits to 24 transects with favourable habitats for terrestrial birds within a 5-km buffer around the River Tua lower valley. The occurrence of the target taxa was documented through 2361 positive observation events. In total, 69 species were identified. The most abundant species were Fringilla coelebs (285 observation events), Turdus merula (249), Sylvia atricapilla (212), Erithacus rubecula (209), Parus major (170), Ptyonoprogne rupestris (134) and Serinus serinus (120).

samplingDescription.studyExtent: The data were collected within a 5-km buffer around the Tua lower valley (Northeast Portugal), up to 50 km from the mouth in the municipalities of Carrazeda de Ansiães, Vila Flor, Alijó and Murça.
samplingDescription.sampling: Sampling was designed to cover the main habitat types for terrestrial birds in and around the lower Tua valley affected by the Foz-Tua dam. Twenty-four transects of variable extension (range: 450-1187 m) were set in 20 2x2 km squares (1-2 transects per square), and visited once in winter (December-January) and spring (March-April) of 2009-10. Each transect was surveyed on foot, at a constant speed, by two observers for at least 30 minutes. All contacts (by sight or ear) with the tarrget species were recorded. Species identification and assessment of age and sex (when possible) were  made “in loco”, with the help of appropriate field guides
samplingDescription.qualityControl: All identifications were performed by qualified technicians
methodSteps: To be completed
